com.group16.proj

Class DisplayDay

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.group16.proj.DisplayDay

  • public class DisplayDay
extends java.lang.Object
    Formats and stores values related to the displaying of wait time information for a given date and at a given border crossing.
    Also contains Methods for sorting this information by time interval and sorting by wait times.
    Author:
    alexgotsko

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private DisplayTime[] dayHours
      array of Display time objects storing formated wait time data
      private int location
      Integer location index ID that time is to displayed at
      private int sortedBy
      Sorted by flag 0 == sorted by hour interval 1 == sorted by wait times
      private int[][] waitTimes
      2d array of wait times every hour for 24 hours and both commercial and passenger wait times

      • DisplayDay

        public DisplayDay(int curLocation,
                  int[][] waitTimes)
        Constructor for DisplayDay Object takes date and array of all the wait times in that day for both types of vehicles.
        Parameters:
        curLocation - String representation of the date going to be displayed
        waitTimes - 2D integer array of wait times, [i][] -- the hours in the day 0 -- 23, [][i] vehicle type [0] | [1] commercial or normal

    • Method Detail

      • getDisplayTimes

        public DisplayTime[] getDisplayTimes()
        Gets all the DisplayTimes in this object Object
        Returns:
        An array of DisplayTime objects sorted by either the hours of the day or by the length of the wait times

      • getLocation

        public int getLocation()
        Gets the location associated with the object
        Returns:
        Integer representation of the objects Border Crossing index ID

      • getSortedBy

        public int getSortedBy()
        Used to get the flag that represents what the current DisplayDayObject is sorted by
        Returns:
        Integer - Sorted by 0 means by hours, sorted by 1 means by wait times

      • sortByHours

        public void sortByHours()
        Sort the array of Display times by the hours of the day 00 - 23 if already sorted perform a reversal of order.

        First check to see if the sort by hours of the day flag is not set, if not, sort the display time object using insertion sort with direct compare ordering it start of day hour 00 to end of day hour 23.

        If the Object is already sorted by hours of the day, perform a order reversal by iterating through half the objects indexes while also keeping track of the indexes from the other end and swapping the Display time objects at those indexes.

      • sortByWaitTimes

        public void sortByWaitTimes()
        Sort the array of Display times by the estimated wait times if already sorted perform a reversal of order.

        First check to see if the sort by wait time flag is not set, if not sort the display time object using insertion sort with direct compare ordering it highest wait time to lowest. If the wait time is the same the order wont change.

        If the Object is already sorted by wait time, perform a order reversal by iterating through half the objects indexes while also keeping track of the indexes from the other end and swapping the Display time objects at those indexes.

      • wTimes

        public int[][] wTimes()
        Gets an array of all the wait times in this Display Day Object
        Returns:
        An array of wait times for every hour of the day and sub arrayed into index 0 truck wait times and index 1 car wait times
